required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Optimal Muscle Tension Management During Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of Optimal Muscle Tension Management During Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy - a Prospective Randomized Control Study

lead_sponsor.agency: National Taiwan University Hospital Hsin-Chu Branch

clinical_study.source: National Taiwan University Hospital Hsin-Chu Branch

brief_summary.textblock: Our study is intended to compare optimal muscle tension management or conventional anesthetic management in laparoscopic cholecystectomy about surgical condition during the surgery and other conditions after surgery at POR.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is intended to recruit 70 patients undergoing laparoscopic cholecystectomy, whom will be randomized to receive optimal muscle tension management or conventional anesthetic management without optimal muscle tension management. Our primary hypothesis is that optimal muscle tension management provides improved surgical conditions and less intra-abdominal pressure required. The secondary endpoints include surgical duration, intraoperative complications, total amount of muscle relaxants, respiratory and hemodynamic changes during surgery, extubation time and any events during post-anesthetic recovery.

primary_outcome.description: Surgeon describe CO2 inflation condition by 4 point King Score (1-4). excellent good acceptable poor or unacceptable

secondary_outcome.description: Mean blood pressure during the CO2 inflation
describe by 11 points Numeric rating scales (0-10). From 0 which means "no pain" to 10 means "worst pain"
Every beat per minutes heart rate during CO2 inflation
Record any respiratory complications including desaturations (<95%, more than 30 seconds, Rispiratory rate < 8), aspiration or airway obstruction

intervention.description: including TOF monitor and reversal of neuromuscular blockade agent : sugammadex

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age 20~80 years old
- ASA score : 1-2
- Regular laparoscopic cholecystectomy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Renal function impairement (eGFR < 60 ml/min/1.73m2) or ESRD
- BMI < 18.5 kg/m2 or >30 kg/m2
- History of other abdominal surgery
- Allergy to rocuronium, cisatracurium, neostigmine or sugammadex
- Emergent surgery
- Convert to open cholecystectomy

overall_official.affiliation: National Taiwan University Hospital Hsinchu Branch

facility.name: National Taiwan University Hospital, Hsin-Chu Branch
